['First impressions - These are initial judgments or opinions formed upon meeting someone for the first time.', 'Hesitant - Showing reluctance to act quickly or decisively, which can be a result of previous negative experiences.', 'Cautious - Acting carefully and deliberately to avoid danger or risk after having encountered it once before.', 'Apprehensive - Having a fearful expectation about something due to past occurrences that have led one to be "twice shy."', 'Wary - Being cautious about possible dangers, which can stem from an experience in the past.', 'Circumspect - Exer mantining care and prudence when making decisions or judgments due to previous experiences that made one wary of repeating actions without scrutiny.', 'Reticent - Being reserved or reluctant to speak, which might be a result of having been hurt or betrayed in the past.', 'Distrusting - Feeling mistrustful due to an experience that has made one cautious about trusting again.', 'Skeptical - Being inclined to doubt the truth or existence of something, which can arise from a first negative encounter with similar circumstances.', 'Guarded - Protective and watchful behavior often as a result of previous experiences that have caused one to be cautious about opening up again.', 'Reclusive - Preferring solitude due to past disappointments or hurt, making it hard to trust others and form new connections.', 'Reticent - Having difficulty forming close relationships because of a previous negative experience that has made one hesitant to let down their guard again.', 'Cautious - Exhibiting carefulness due to past events where being hasty or careless led to unfavorable outcomes.', 'Guarded - Being reserved and cautious in interactions, especially with new acquaintances, as a result of previous letdowns or betrayals.', 'Apprehensive - Feeling uneasy or anxious about something due to past experiences that have made one reluctant to repeat the same actions without caution.', 'Hesitant - Showing doubt or delay in action, which can be attributed to a prior incident where acting quickly resulted in negative consequences.', 'Cautious - Exercising care and restraint because of previous instances that highlighted the risks involved without adequate consideration.', 'Skeptical - Doubting or questioning the reliability or truthfulness of something, potentially due to a past encounter with deceit or falsehoods.', 'Risk-averse - ['Gesture - An action performed with the body to express an idea or feeling; when misinterpreted, it can be seen as impolite.', 'Eye roll - A dismissive facial expression indicating annoyance or skepticism which might come off as rude in some contexts.', 'Finger pointing - Directing attention using a finger that may seem accusatory or disrespectful if done rudely.', 'Push away (hand motion) - A forceful hand movement signaling rejection, potentially considered rude when aggressive.', 'Crossed arms (defensive posture) - Body language indicating resistance or hostility which can be perceived as impolite in certain situations.', 'Hand wave with a twist of the wrist - An abrupt or exaggerated gesture that may be misinterpreted as rude.', 'Head shake (no) - A negative response to a question, which can come off as dismissive and rude if overdone.', 'Shove (physical contact) - Forcibly moving someone in one direction, often considered an aggressive and rude act.', 'Thumbs down (negative gesture) - A hand signal denoting disapproval or disagreement that can be seen as disrespectful if delivered harshly.', 'Snub - Intentionally ignoring someone, which may be perceived as rude in many social contexts.', 'Dismissive wave (hand gesture) - A casual or flippant waving that might convey a lack of respect and come off as impolite.', 'Pat on the back (inappropriate timing) - An encouraging touch misplaced in its timing, possibly seen as patronizing when done rudely.', "Shouted words (loud voice) - Expressing oneself loudly can be considered rude if it's unnecessarily aggressive or confrontational.", 'Mockery movement (mimicking action) - An imitation of someone that may convey mockery, often perceived as disrespectful and impolite.', 'Blocking gesture (obstructing space) - Physically preventing access to an area or person which can be deemed rude if done with intent to exclude.', 'Flipping someone over (aggressive action) - An extreme physical act that is inherently aggressive and clearly considered impolite.', 'Tug on sleeve abruptly (unwelcome touch) - A sudden, forceful tugging which may be perceived as intrusive or rude if done without consent.', "Invasion of personal space (uncomfortably close proximity) - Entering someone's personal bubble uninvited, which might be seen as disrespectful or rude.", 'Fist-pumping aggressively (intimidating gesture) - A strong and forceful pumping of the fist that could be perceived as threatening and impolite if done excessively.']

A rich and creamy dessert made with melted chocolate, whipped cream or egg yolks, typically served cold.', 'Madeleine - Small sponge cakes flavored with lemon zest, popular in France for their buttery taste and distinctive shell shape.', 'Éclair au chocolat (Chocolate éclair) - A pastry made of choux dough filled with a rich cream filling and topped with chocolate icing or glaze.', 'Gâteau Basque - A traditional French cake flavored with brandy, almonds, and vanilla, often served with custard on the side.', 'Clafoutis - A baked dessert of fruit (typically cherries) cooked in a sugar-and-egg mixture poured into a pan.', 'Framboise (Raspberry tart) - A pastry filled with raspberries, often served as a light and fruity dessert or after-dinner treat.', 'Clafoutis aux pêches (Peach clafoutis) - Similar to the traditional fruit tart but using peaches instead of cherries.', 'Baba au rhum (Rum babà) - A French dessert made from a yeast-leavened cake, soaked in rum and dusted with sugar.', 'Choux à la crème - Puff pastry filled with rich custard that is then often topped with icing or glaze, commonly served as éclairs, profiteroles, or cream puffs.', 'Mousse au chocolat (Chocolate mousse) - A light and airy dessert made from whipped egg whites, heavy cream, and chocolate.', 'Tarte au citron (Lemon tart) - A French-style tart featuring a buttery pastry base topped with a sweet lemon custard and decorative zest.', 'Cannelle et vanille (Cinnamon and vanilla) - The combination of cinnamon and vanilla flavors is prominent in many classic French desserts, such as crème brûlée or éclairs.', 'Gâteau de Noël (Yule log cake) - A traditional Christmas dessert shaped like a tree trunk filled with creamy chocolate and decorated to resemble bark.', 'Pistachio génoise - A light and fluffy sponge cake made from eggs, sugar, flour, and ground pistachios, often served in layers or as a base for other desserts.', 'Madeleines (Almond cookies) - Small, shell-shaped pastries that are flavored with the distinctive taste of almond flour.']
